intro: Sipanea prancei, commonly known as the Pohnpei starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the island of Pohnpei in the Caroline Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant produces bright yellow to orange fruits that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. Sipanea prancei is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
